text: [Music]
my name is Lim McCleary I've been
working at Amazon Web Services for
almost three and a half years and I'm
currently an account manager responsible
for our strategic startups across the UK
I work with a select group of startups
and these are some of the most
disruptive fast growth organizations
across the country and my role is to
firstly make sure they have a wonderful
experience engaging with us as a
provider of their technology platform
but also help them make best use of our
services as well so the reason I joined
AWS was prior to being here I was
working in a start-up environments and
consulting organizations to start using
cloud and this is very much in the early
days of cloud computing and I recognize
that AWS were at the front of the pack
lead leading this really disruptive
change in the industry and I wanted to
be part of that change so what I find
most satisfying about working at AWS is
the opportunity to take a really long
term view on our business and by that
what I mean is engaging with customers
and determining what they want to
achieve over the next five 10 15 20
years from now rather than just over the
next quarter and what I want to do as a
business they call it would be native
u.s. it's all about the customer and
what they're trying to achieve I think
for anybody that was considering moving
to eight of us go online and understand
our leadership principles first and
foremost they really are the leading
lights for our business it's everything
that we all stand by and we are quite
peculiar in that way so understanding
what they are and why they're important
to us is firstly very important but
secondly I would look to just attend
some meetup groups or attend some of our
events and speak to our customers speak
to people that work and with us already
get an understanding of still you know
why do they like enjoyed working with
AWS
we really have the opportunity to make a
meaningful difference to the economy to
other people's organizations and really
disrupt the way things have been done in
the past being at AWS you're empowered
to make your own decisions and really
consider what you want to do for your
future but also for your customers and
their futures and I think that really
does set us
in terms of having that ability to do so
[Music]
